revised_title: Maximum Discharge Through a Pipe of Circular Section Due to Pipe Inclination
tldr: The author investigates the maximum discharge through a pipe of circular section when the effective head is due only to the pipe's inclination. They find that a circular pipe carries more liquid when filled up to nineteen-twentieths of its diameter than when completely full, which they call a "hydraulic paradox." This result can be utilized in circular drain-pipes that may be coated with sediments.
